subject: Law
title: Women's Suffrage and the 19th Amendment
description: A 60-second lesson on Women's Suffrage and the 19th Amendment.

hook.text: For 144 years, American women couldn't vote. In 1920, the 19th Amendment finally changed that.

buildup.text: The women's suffrage movement fought for decades through protests, hunger strikes, and political organizing.

discovery.text: The 19th Amendment states: 'The right to vote shall not be denied on account of sex.'

twist.text: The victory was incomplete. Black women faced extra barriers and couldn't fully exercise their vote until the 1960s.

climax.text: The suffrage movement also inspired later civil rights and equality movements worldwide.

punchline.text: Half the population was excluded. One amendment fixed the law, not the culture.
